Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: Become an Events Coordinator
headline: In this free online event management course, you will learn about the different aspects of the Event Planning business.
description: In this free online course, you will study all areas of event planning as a business, including invitations, decorating, marketing, catering, waste disposal and security. Discover how to distinguish between different event types and understand their specific requirements, such as appropriate food, seating, dress codes as well as learn to leverage the power of social media in marketing your events and event planning business.
courseDescription:
Events are an essential part of our social and business lives. We all delight in different kinds of events such as weddings and business meetings from time to time, but, have you ever wondered at the amount of planning and strategizing involved in making them successful? Event planning and coordination is a very demanding and satisfying job. It requires an aesthetic sense, a knowledge of etiquette and business skills. You also need to think out-of-the-box for that unique touch that none of your competitors provides. If you believe that you have what it takes to be an event coordinator, then this events course is for you because it will teach you everything you need to know to plan and host an event and develop your own event planning business.

This event planning course is divided into two modules. The first module covers all aspects of planning a successful event and you will look at the different types of events, their characteristics, unique requirements and learn to understand the expectations of your guests/attendees and other stakeholders to decide the decor, ambience, food, and promotion. You will learn the invitation basics, the appropriate themes and dress codes for each occasion as well as the all-important decor aspects of the occasion. The first module finishes by covering event marketing, branding, selling, and promotion. In the second module, you will learn how to develop an event planning business. This section begins with formulating a business model and the content provides valuable tips on generating a client base, getting more referrals, streamlining your business operations, and building a brand. Every business needs to partner with reliable suppliers and vendors. In the events industry, you will need to choose the perfect caterers and security and this events tutorial teaches you how to identify them and work with them for mutual success as well as one of the most critical responsibilities which is cleaning up and waste management. You will see that not only can you reduce garbage, you can also make a profit out of the waste.

For most organisations, an event is an opportunity for personal interactions with clients, employees, business partners, and other stakeholders. Family events are occasions of family unions and reuniting with friends. Understandably, the event sponsors like to make it a memorable experience. However, few can spare the time and effort required to organize their events in today’s fast-paced world. That is where event coordinators come in. It’s no wonder that specialist event planners and coordinators are in such high demand these days. If you would like to become a professional event coordinator, this course will prepare you to stay ahead of the competition and carve a niche for yourself in the world of event management.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital : a downloadable in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our pricing, please visit our Pricing Page
slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • After completing this module, you will be able to:
    • List the different types of events.
    • Define an event's goals and objectives.
    • Outline the steps to plan an event.
    • Describe the common methods to invite guests to an event keeping them connected to a theme. 
    • Analyse the significance of the different dress codes specified for events. 
    • Distinguish between the aesthetics and decorations that can be applied to different event types.
    • Discuss the different aspects of event marketing.
    • Summarize the concepts of partnership event marketing and account-based event marketing.

  • Lesson Summary

    • Live music and performances will always attract a core audience depending on the fan base of the artists performing.
    • Trade shows provide an opportunity for like-minded consumers and professionals to trade ideas and products in a shared setting and on a common theme.
    • Wedding planners can specialise in differing service levels, from single day contributions to over-sea events and travel.
    • Anniversary celebrations can range from intimate weekends away to milestone parties with multiple guests.
    • Most events will benefit from social media interaction, and promotional material should include hashtags and other relevant online details.
    • The very first step in planning your event is to establish a tangible goal and objectives.
    • Organising a team is always important as you can't always organise an event single-handedly.
    • Many great ideas fall by the wayside because the team who originally comes up with it forgets to consider their budget before planning.
    • Even with the most amazing speaker or entertainment line-up, you need publicity to get people in the door.
    • To ensure you're prepared for anything, prepare an agenda that will walk you through the whole day from setup to cleanup.
    • Assess your event to see what went well and what you can do better next time.

  • Learning Outcomes

  • After completing this module you will be able to:
    • Define an event planning business model.
    • Discuss ways to generate a client base.
    • List the five essential elements of business operations.
    • Outline the importance of networking.
    • Summarize the considerations for the catering of an important event.
    • Classify event wastes into different categories.
    • Indicate the best practices in waste management.
    • Identify the kinds of precautions that can be taken to ensure guests' safety and well being.

  • Lesson Summary

    • An event planning business model is a document that guides the major aspects of your business and its objectives in the long term.
    • Your business model should be reviewed every three months and amended to reflect current operational needs and market changes.
    • Build a client base by gaining loyal clients and using various methods to promote and expand your network.
    • Business operations refer to regular activities that an organisation drives to earn profit and increase value.
    • Good vendor management will enable you to build relationships with other businesses and share mutual benefits.
    • The contents of a menu should consider local produce and availability, as well as the theme of an event.
    • All caterers will need to know about food allergies and dietary requirements before the event occurs.
    • The headcount and schedule of an event will often drive the most appropriate catering type, from buffets to plated meals.
    • Business lunches may need special planning to accommodate interactivity and working materials.
    • Presentation and attention to detail can boost the appreciation of a catered event to another level.
